title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 853.9 - Additional qualifications to receive a Gambling designation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 853.9 - Additional qualifications to receive a Gambling designation

State Regulations
(a) Gambling designations. A CASAC, a CPP or CPS may acquire an
additional Gambling specialty designation (CASAC-G, CPP-G or CPS-G) by meeting
additional requirements as determined by the Office. (b) Current Credentialed Problem

Gambling Counselor (CPGC). (1)

Individuals whose CPGC is valid at the time of the adoption of this Part, may, upon expiration of their credential: (i) renew the credential pursuant to section
853.11
(b) of this

Part; or
(ii)
problem gambling
professionals as a Qualified Problem Gambling Professional as defined in Part
857 of this Title. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
